instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v 300ma
threads.message:
There doesnt seems to be any kind of corrosion or spillage on the board. I dont have a known good battery for this but I have by-3200 here connected to bench supply.
current at 300ma without battery and goes up to 1.2a then back to 30ma with battery in, same with original charger. <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> @70c heat. is this a common issue on this board ?
L9530  <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL>  is reading short, remove and pad 2 reading short to ground. Dead nand?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v 300ma
threads.message: If is pure short, something must heat injecting voltage.
